8. LICENSEE'S WARRANTIES 
8.1 Except as expressly set out in this EULA or as permitted by any applicable mandatory law, Licensee warrants, represents and undertakes that it shall: 
 
(ⅰ) bear all risks for the use of this Software and possesses all rights and conditions required for the running of this Software (in particular, the Licensee must ensure that it has the right to use the relevant operating system required for the operation of the Software); and 
 
(ⅱ) use the Software in accordance with the provisions of this EULA and all applicable laws. 
 
9. PERSONAL INFORMATION 
 
9.1 Tencent respects the privacy of the Licensee’s personal data. Tencent will treat any personal data provided by Licensee in the course of using the Software or Services in accordance with the Privacy Statement (subject to applicable law). 
 
10. CONSENT TO THE USE OF MOBILE DEVICE RESOURCES 
 
10.1 The Licensee hereby acknowledges, consents and agrees that the Software may make use of the Licensee's resources for the purpose of the Software’s performance of its functions and otherwise fulfilling Tencent’s obligations and rights under this EULA, such as the processor of the Licensee's mobile device and the bandwidth, for the limited purposes of maintaining and managing battery life, showing memory statuses, managing software in the mobile device, and/or performing fee scanning, anti-virus functions. Where applicable, the costs of such use by the Software of the Licensee's resources (including without limitation costs of service providers) shall be solely borne by the Licensee. 
 
10.2 The Licensee acknowledges and agrees that Tencent will use its commercially reasonable efforts to protect the Licensee's mobile device resources and the privacy and completeness of the Licensee's communications via the mobile device. However, the Licensee acknowledges and agrees that Tencent does not provide any warranty or guarantee in relation to such matters and has no liability in relation to such matter. 
 
11. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY 
NOTWITHSTANDING ANY DAMAGES THAT LICENSEE MIGHT INCUR FOR ANY REASON WHATSOEVER AND TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, THE ENTIRE LIABILITY OF TENCENT AND ANY OF ITS SUPPLIERS UNDER ANY PROVISION OF THIS EULA AND LICENSEE’S EXCLUSIVE REMEDY FOR ALL OF THE FOREGOING SHALL BE LIMITED AND IN NO EVENT WILL TENCENT OR ITS SUPPLIERS TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY EXCEED FIVE (5) CHINESE RENMINBI. IN ADDITION, TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, IN NO EVENT SHALL TENCENT, ITS AFFILIATES, EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS OR AGENTS BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, INDIRECT, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHATSOEVER. 
 
12. INDEMNIFICATION 
12.1 By accepting this EULA, Licensee agrees to indemnify and otherwise hold harmless Tencent, its officers, employee, agents, subsidiaries, Affiliates, and other partners from any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, exemplary or other damages arising out of, relating to, or resulting from Licensee’s use of the Software or receipt of the Services, or any other matter relating to the Software, Services or this EULA. 
12.2 For the avoidance of doubt, if the Licensee's breach of this EULA (including but not limited to the acts stipulated in Clause 3.1 above) or relevant terms of Service brings about any third party's claims, demands or losses to Tencent, including attorney's fee, the Licensee hereby agrees to indemnify and hold Tencent harmless from all losses caused by said claims, demands or losses. 
 
13. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY 
 
13.1 The Software is protected by intellectual property laws (including without limitation the Copyright Law of the PRC and Trademark Law of the PRC) and international copyright treaties, as well as other intellectual property laws and treaties. Licensee hereby acknowledges that all intellectual property rights in the Software (including but not limited to any images, text, interface frameworks, icons, designs, audio, video, and "applets" incorporated into the Software) throughout the world belong to Tencent, that rights in the Software are licensed (not sold) to Licensee, and that Licensee has no rights in, or to, the Software other than the right to use it in accordance with the terms of this EULA. Licensee acknowledges and agrees that Licensee has no right to access the Software in source code form. 
 
13.2 The Licensee further agrees and acknowledges that all the contents in any advertisements and commercial information provided by Tencent for the Licensee via the Software and Services are protected by copyright laws and international copyright treaties, as well as other intellectual property laws and treaties. The Licensee may only use content from said advertisements or commercial information with the written consent of Tencent, and shall not copy, amend or compile said advertisements or commercial, or create derivative products based on the same without Tencent's authorization. 
 
13.3 Tencent, 腾讯, the Tencent logo, and other Tencent names and logos are the trademarks of Tencent, use of which for any purposes by the Licensee without the written consent from Tencent is strictly prohibited. Tencent reserves all rights to claim remedies against the Licensee, including without limitation damages and injunctive relief, in respect of any unauthorized use of Tencent's intellectual property. 
 
14. ENTIRE AGREEMENT 
The EULA constitutes the entire agreement between Tencent and Licensee and governs Licensee’s use of the Software, superseding any prior agreement between Licensee and Tencent relating to the subject matter hereof. If any provision of this EULA is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be contrary to law, such provision will be changed and interpreted so as to best accomplish the objectives of the original provision to the fullest extent allowed by law and the remaining provisions of the EULA will remain in full force and effect. 
15. ASSIGNMENT 
Licensee may not assign this EULA, and any attempted assignment will be null and void. Tencent may assign this EULA at any time to any third party at its sole discretion. 
16. GOVERNING LAW 
 
This EULA will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region ("HKSAR") without regard to conflict of laws principles. 
 
17. DISPUTE RESOLUTION 
 
17.1 Any dispute or controversy under this EULA shall firstly be resolved through amicable negotiation. If no agreement is reached through such negotiations, the parties hereby agree to refer the dispute or controversy to arbitration pursuant to Clause 17.2 below. 
 
17.2 Subject to Clause 17.1 above, the parties agree that any dispute, controversy or claim arising out or relating to this EULA, or the breach, termination or invalidity thereof, shall be settled by final and binding arbitration in Hong Kong under the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre Administered Arbitration Rules in force when the Notice of Arbitration is submitted in accordance with these Rules. The place of arbitration shall be in Hong Kong at the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre ("HKIAC"). 
 
17.3 The tribunal for any arbitration shall consist of three arbitrators with each party appointing one arbitrator and the two arbitrators thus appointed shall choose the third arbitrator who will act as the presiding arbitrator of the Tribunal. 
 
17.4 The language to be used in the arbitral proceedings shall be English. 
 
17.5 The applicable law shall be the laws of the Hong Kong. 
 
18. LANGUAGE 
This EULA is written in English; where it is translated into another language at sole discretion of Tencent or by the requirement of law, the English version shall prevail in the event of any inconsistency between such different language versions of this EULA. 
19. ENQUIRIES 
 If the Licensee has any questions or comments as regards this Software, please contact Tencent at the below contact details: 
Customer Service Hotline of Tencent: 0755-83765566. Service Website: http://www.theonesecurity.com 
 
Tencent Mobile Doctor Ltd 
SCHEDULE 1

Privacy Statement for Tencent One Security Software 
Last updated: [2013-1-18] 
Tencent Mobile Doctor Ltd (“Tencent” or “we”) is committed to protecting your privacy while providing you with the products and services that serve your needs. The operation of these products and services may require the collection and use of your personal information. This privacy statement explains how Tencent collects and uses your personal information by the Software ("Software") in those situations. This privacy statement only applies to the Software and Services and does not apply to other Tencent websites, products or services (for clarity, all references to “Software” in this Privacy Statement also refer to the Services, unless the context requires otherwise). Please read the following Privacy Statement to understand how Tencent uses any information collected from you through your use of the Software. 
This Privacy Statement is current as of the “last updated” date set forth above. Tencent reserves the right to change this statement from time to time, so please be sure to check back periodically. Updated versions of this Privacy Statement will also be available in future updates to the Software. 
By installing or using the Software, you acknowledge, agree and consent that your Personal Information (as defined below) will be handled as described in this Privacy Statement, which is incorporated by reference into the Software End User License and Services Agreement for Tencent One Security Software (“EULA”). 
It is your responsibility to read and accept the terms of service and privacy policies for the websites you visit. Tencent is not responsible for the privacy practices of other entities, including websites whose advertisements may appear on the Software. This Privacy Statement applies solely to information collected by Tencent with your use of the Software. 
Where there is any inconsistency between the English and any other language versions of this Privacy Statement, the English version will prevail to the extent of such inconsistency. 
Defined terms in this Privacy Statement, if not defined in this Privacy Statement, have the meaning as given under the EULA. 
INFORMATION WE COLLECT FROM YOU 
What information Tencent collects or receives from you depends on how you use the Software, which may include the following: 
Your Personal Information 
"Personal Information" is information that you provide to Tencent which personally identifies you, such as your name, telephone number, identification number, email address, or credit card details. When you provide your Personal Information to Tencent using the Software, Tencent receives and stores this information in order to respond to your instructions and requests. For example, we may use your Personal Information when providing you with customer technical support. You can choose not to provide your Personal Information, but then you might not be able to take advantage of all the features in the Software. 
Non-Personal Information 
"Non-Personal Information" is information that cannot be directly associated with a specific person or entity. Non-Personal Information includes but is not limited to your computer’s configuration and the version of the Software you are using. 
Information We Collect Automatically 
We receive and store certain types of information whenever you interact with us. For example, we automatically send and receive information to and from your mobile device which we use to determine which version of the Software you are using so that we may automatically update (new features, bug fixes, etc.) the Software and Services that you may use. Like many mobile applications, the Software may collect any personal information that you have inputted into your mobile device when you use the Software (for example, by using the address book synchronization function of the Software). The Software also supports the use of automated tools to obtain certain types of information to make your usage of the Software more convenient. Though such information will typically be used in an aggregated way to improve our products and services, some information we collect, including your usage patterns or preferences, may be used to personalize your experience, or to offer you products and services specifically based on your preferences and usage. 
In addition, our servers automatically recognize your IP address and other technical information about your mobile device. See the section below entitled “IP Address Information” for more information. 
All information received and stored as the aforesaid will be encrypted to ensure the personal data security and will be sent through a digital certificate encryption channel during data exchange between clients and servers with valid security certificates for websites and mobile clients. All local back-up information is encrypted and saved to protect the Licensee’s personal information if the Licensee loses the mobile device. However, Tencent, its affiliates, employees, officers and agents shall not be liable for any loss of information of the Licensee. 
 
IP Address Information 
Each time you use the Software, your wireless telecom services operator will provide our web server with your IP address, as well as other technical information about your mobile device. In addition, our servers may look up the IP address and other information about your mobile device so that Tencent can: 1) display specific or localized content and advertisements that may interest you based on the geographic location of handheld device, or 2) to enable certain features of the Software. We do not combine your IP address or location information with personally identifiable information about you. 
HOW TENCENT USES YOUR INFORMATION 
Tencent may use the information we collect about you for any of the following purposes: 
• To carry out Software or Service-related verification, upgrade, security or customer support purposes. 
 
• To better understand how users access and use our products and services, including the Software, on an aggregated and individualized basis, for the purposes of improving our products and services, and to respond to customer desires and preferences. 
 
• To improve our products and services by providing personalized experiences and recommendations, language and location customization, personalized help and instructions, or other responses to your and other customers’ usage of our products and services. 
 
• To communicate with you for other customer service, software verification or software upgrades. This may include location verification for products and services which may have limited geographical access, and the like. 
 
• To offer you content, services, games or other products and services. 
 
• To allow you to participate in surveys about products and services. 
 
• To receive and process payments from you (where applicable) in relation to the Software. 
 
• To improve our products and services by providing language and location customization, personalized help and instructions, or other responses to your and other customers’ usage of our products and services. 
 
• To acquire software installation information for cloud anti-virus functions that requires server computation and instructions. 
 
In addition, we may use your Personal Information for the purpose of sending you messages (whether by messaging within the Software or by email, SMS or other means) offering or advertising: 
 
• our goods and services and the goods and services of our affiliate and subsidiary companies and joint venture partners (including any value-added services), including instant messaging services, online media services, interactive entertainment services, social networking services, payment services, internet search services, location and mapping services, on-line advertising services and other social media, entertainment, e-commerce, information and communications software and services (“Internet Services”); and 
 
• third party providers of Internet Services and goods and services relating to dining, food and beverages, sports, music, film, television and other entertainment, clothing and accessories, jewelry, cosmetics, personal health and hygiene, electronics, home furnishings, and housewares, automobiles, transport and travel, banking, insurance and financial services, loyalty and reward programs and other goods and services that we think may be relevant to you. 
 
We will honor your request to not use your Personal Information for all or any of the marketing purposes noted above. If you do not wish to receive offers or advertising from us or only wish to receive certain offers or advertising, please notify our Privacy Officer at cs@theonesecurity.com. 
We do not sell or rent your Personal Information to any third party, but we may disclose information about you to third parties acting on our behalf or who are our Affiliates (as defined in the EULA). These third parties may assist Tencent with marketing, resolving service problems, and correcting errors related to the execution of Tencent’s products including the Software. However, we do not give these third parties (other than our subsidiaries and affiliates) an independent right to share or use your personal information. Such disclosure is further described in the below section. 
In addition, we may from time to time disclose Non-Personal Information to any third parties as at our discretion. 
HOW AND WHEN TENCENT SHARES INFORMATION 
Information about our users is an important part of our business, and we are not in the business of selling it to others. We share customer information only as compatible with the purposes described above, and when we have your permission or as described in this section. 
Tencent Affiliates 
We may share your information with our Affiliates (as defined in the EULA) but only if those Affiliates are either subject to this Privacy Statement or follow practices at least as protective as those described in this Privacy Statement. These Affiliates may be located outside of your jurisdiction. 
Contractors and Agents 
We may employ other companies and individuals to perform functions on our behalf. Examples include without limitation sending postal mail and e-mail, removing repetitive information from customer lists, analyzing data, providing marketing assistance (including data concerning marketing and promotional programs), or providing customer service or for other purposes within the ordinary course of business. These third parties, which may be located outside of your jurisdiction, have access to the Personal Information needed to perform their functions on our behalf. We require these companies to agree (ⅰ) to provide adequate protections for your Personal Information that are no less protective than those set out in this Privacy Policy and (ⅱ) to use your Personal Information only for the purposes for which the third party has been engaged by us. Tencent or its affiliates are not liable for the acts or omissions of these third parties, except as provided by applicable law. 
Business Transfers 
As Tencent continues to develop our business, we might sell or buy online stores, subsidiaries, or other businesses. In such transactions, customer information generally would be one of the transferred business assets but remains subject to the promises made in any pre-existing privacy statement or policy (unless, of course, the customer consents otherwise). Also, in the event that Tencent, or substantially all of its assets are acquired, we will provide notice before customer information, including your Personal Information, is transferred and becomes subject to a different privacy statement or policy. 
Protection of Tencent 
Tencent reserve the right to disclose your personal information when we believe such disclosure are required to comply with the law, judicial proceeding, court order or other legal process; to enforce or apply the terms of the EULA; or protect the rights, property, or safety of Tencent, our employees, our users, or others. This includes exchanging information with other companies and organizations for fraud protection and credit risk reduction purposes. This does not include selling, renting, sharing, or otherwise disclosing Personal Information from customers for commercial purposes in violation of this Privacy Statement. 
 
RETENTION OF YOUR INFORMATION 
We may retain any Personal Information collected from you for the period necessary to fulfill the purposes as outlined in this Privacy Statement unless a longer retention period is required by applicable law. 
SECURITY OF YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION 
Tencent is committed to protecting the security of your Personal Information. We use a variety of security technologies and procedures to help protect your Personal Information from loss, misuse, unauthorized access, use, disclosure, alteration and destruction. 
We work to protect the security of your Personal Information during transmission by using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) software, which encrypts information you provide to Tencent while using the Software. 
Please be aware that despite our best efforts, no data security measures can guarantee 100% security all of the time and Tencent is not liable for any breach of your data or mobile device in connection with your use of the Software. 
Any information we collect will be securely processed, stored and archived in databases and backups that could reside outside of your jurisdiction, including without limitation the People's Republic of China. 
If you have any questions about the security of your information, please contact us at cs@theonesecurity.com. 
 
ACCESS TO AND CORRECTION OF YOUR INFORMATION 
Tencent will take commercially reasonable steps to ensure that the Personal Information we collect and store is reliable, accurate, complete and current. You also have the right to be given a copy of any Personal Information which Tencent holds concerning you (and for which we may charge a small fee to process) and to have any inaccuracies in your personal data that is stored by us to be corrected and/or erased. You may exercise any such rights by emailing at cs@theonesecurity.com. We will need you to provide us with sufficient information to establish your identity and to verify your access request and also to assist us in dealing with your request. Requests will be processed in a reasonably timely manner. 
 
VOLUNTARY PROVISION OF PERSONAL INFORMATION 
 
As mentioned above, you can at any time choose not to provide your Personal Information to Tencent, but that may prevent you from being able to use or take advantage of specific features of the Software. 
If you choose to use the Software, any dispute over privacy is subject to this Privacy Statement and the provisions of the EULA and the VIP Terms, including without limitation applicable limitations on damages, arbitration of disputes, and application of the law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. 
If you have any concerns about your privacy or this Privacy Statement, please contact us by emailing at cs@theonesecurity.com with a thorough description or your question or concern, and we will try to resolve it. 
EXEMPTION OF LIABILITY 
Tencent, its Affiliates, employees, officers and agents shall have no liability for any breach of this Privacy Policy, except as required by applicable law, including: (ⅰ) any disclosure of your Personal Information as required by law or relevant governmental authority; (ⅱ) any disclosure of your Personal Information as a result of your own actions or negligent acts (including without limitation the disclosure by you of your Personal Information to any websites, forums, or social networking sites); (ⅲ) any consequence resulting from hackers, computer viruses or temporary closure of our services; or (ⅳ) any consequence resulting from Acts of God or any other events that are beyond Tencent’s reasonable control. 
In addition, all provisions of the EULA and the VIP Terms, including without limitation the limitation of liability and indemnification provisions shall also apply. 
CONTACT US 
If you have questions about the privacy aspects of our products or services, please contact us at cs@theonesecurity.com.
